title: Pakistan: Citi Joins Hands with Top Management School, LUMS, For Project 'Change'
summary: Karachi - Citi Pakistan has partnered with the Lahore University of Management Sciences (LUMS) for 'Project Change,' a capacity-building program that aims to create stronger links between universities and industry.
tag-1: Pakistan: Citi Joins Hands with Top Management School, LUMS, For Project 'Change'
tag-2: Karachi – Citi Pakistan has partnered with the Lahore University of Management Sciences (LUMS) for 'Project Change,' a capacity-building program that aims to create stronger links between universities and industry.
tag-3: Project Change looks at the way academic institutions in Pakistan are connecting with the industry and community and identifies ways in which the relevance of education being imparted at these institutions can be made more effective, with a view to enhancing the earning potential of Pakistan's youth.
tag-4: As part of this program, a two-day workshop will be held with relevant stakeholders to create best practices and learn from success stories, both locally and from across the world. This program is based on a $50,000 grant from the Citi Foundation.
tag-5: "We are optimistic that this initiative will contribute positively to the development of young people in Pakistan by improving their employment prospects," said Karim Seifeddine, Citi's Head of Corporate Affairs for the Middle East, Africa & Pakistan. "LUMS is a longstanding community partner for Citi and the Citi Foundation, and we are hopeful that this joint endeavor will help us strengthen our responsible finance efforts for youth in Pakistan."
tag-6: "LUMS is excited to be partnering with Citi and the Citi Foundation on yet another major and far-reaching community initiative. This latest program will provide a unique platform for diverse stakeholders to come together to provide a blueprint for our academic institutions, industry and community, to use as a roadmap for strengthening their linkages in Pakistan," said Professor Dr. Syed Zahoor Hassan, former Vice Chancellor LUMS and Project Lead for this initiative.
tag-7: Citi has recently won two global awards for its Corporate Social Responsibility projects in Pakistan, particularly in the fields of microfinance, vocational training and education. 2012 is Citi's 200th year globally and such an initiative reiterates its longstanding commitment to the communities where it operates, through a 'More than Philanthropy' approach.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
